title: Poetry for Physicists
description: Physicists have spoken of the beauty of equations. The poet John Keats wrote, “Beauty is truth, truth beauty . . .” What did they mean? Students will consider such questions while reading relevant essays and poems. Requirements include one creative exercise or presentation. Students may not receive credit for both LTEN 30 and PHYS 30.  Prerequisites:  CAT 2 and 3 or DOC 2 and 3 or HUM 1 and 2 or MCWP 40 and 50 or MMW 12 and 13 or WARR 11A-B or WCWP 10A-B. Completion of college writing requirement.
